results.title: Breast ductal lavage for biomarker assessment in high risk women: rationale, design and methodology of a randomized phase II clinical trial with nimesulide, simvastatin and placebo
results.text_hl: From 2005 to 2011, 150 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with a history of @GENE_ESR1 @GENE_2099 @@@estrogen receptor@@@ negative @DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@ductal intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ or @DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@lobular intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Endometrial_Hyperplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004714 @@@atypical hyperplasia@@@, or unaffected subjects carrying a mutation of @GENE_BRCA1 @GENE_672 @@@BRCA1@@@ or with a probability of mutation >10% (according to BRCAPRO) were randomized to receive @CHEMICAL_nimesulide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C012655 @@@nimesulide@@@ 100mg/day versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20mg/day versus placebo for one year followed by a second year of follow-up.

citations.NLM: Lazzeroni M, Guerrieri-Gonzaga A, Serrano D, Cazzaniga M, Mora S, Casadio C, Jemos C, Pizzamiglio M, Cortesi L, Radice D, Bonanni B. Breast ductal lavage for biomarker assessment in high risk women: rationale, design and methodology of a randomized phase II clinical trial with nimesulide, simvastatin and placebo BMC Cancer. 2012 Dec 5;12():575. PMID: 23216985
